body_content.explanation: to laugh at someone or say unkind things about them, either because you are joking or because you want to upset that person:
examples: I used to hate being teased about my red hair when I was at school.
I was just teasing - I didn't mean to upset you.

body_content.explanation: to give a small amount of information about a subject, product, etc. in order to make people interested in seeing or hearing more about it later:
examples: The announcement teased a possible European tour the following year.
He refused to give specifics but teased that "people are going to love it."

body_content.explanation: to hold your hair away from your head and brush it towards your head with a comb, in order to make it look thicker
someone who is always teasing people:
examples: Johnny, don't be such a tease - leave your sister alone!

body_content.explanation: someone who enjoys causing sexual excitement and interest in people she or he does not intend to have sex with
